document_data.name: Sea Elvish
document_data.mainbody: '''Sea elvish''',<ref> or '''sea elven''', was a distinct dialect of the [[Elven language]] spoken by [[sea elves]].
document_data.Speakers:
Beyond the sea elves themselves, and [[malenti]].<ref>{{Cite dragon/250/Heroes of the Sea|30}} And though they could not speak it themselves, the dialect was comprehensible to some [[dolphin]]s and [[whale]]s.<ref>

Some of the individual [[specialty priest]]s of aquatic deities were known to learn various other aquatic languages, such as Sea Elvish. These included the [[waveservant]]s of [[Umberlee]] and the [[waterwalker]]s of [[Istishia]].
document_data.Phonology: While spoken Sea Elvish was quite recognizable as being related to Elvish, it was distinct enough to make the dialect not immediately understandable by the other elven races, which could result in momentary language barriers. However, like other Elvish dialects, most of it could usually be understood by the other elven subraces. It also incorporated interspersion of clicks, squeals, and whistles, similar to those used in the [[dolphin language|language of dolphins]].
document_data.Script: Just like standard Elvish, Sea Elvish used the [[Espruar]] alphabet.{{Cite organized play/LC/And the Deep Blue Sea|9}}<ref> It had a distinctive style to it, which displayed influences from Aquan.

Derivative Languages.Karpri Sea Elvish: A dialect of the language spoken by the sea elves of the planet [[Karpri]]. Beyond the native sea elves themselves, it was a common secondary language among elves of the [[Elven Imperial Fleet]].
Derivative Languages.Serusan: a pidgin language used by the various aquatic races of [[Ser√¥s]], featured elements of Sea Elvish.

document_data.Magic: The [[spell]] ''[[aura of the sea]]'' would automatically translate any spoken Sea Elvish into [[Common]] for those also standing within the aura.<ref>
document_data.Notable Speakers: * [[Ashakar Piscelene]], a [[triton]] [[wizard]], was capable of speaking and understanding this language.<ref>
